intro: Lipochaeta lobata var. heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are notably variable in shape, ranging from lanceolate to ovate, which is reflected in its varietal name. The species is also known for its yellow disc flowers and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
